page.title: 112000 YEARS OF WORSHIP
page.content: In Govan, there has been continious worship longer than any other place in Britain. Previously the{Druids} worshipped here. Over the centuries, the worship has been Celtic,{Roman {Catholic,}Anglican and{Presbyterian and Govan Old Parish Church, built on a historic site contains many ancient stones, one with the sun on one side and the cross on the other. The last century brought many Irish here in search of work. They were mostly{Roman Catholic}and today there are several{R.C.}parishes within the area, such as St. Constatine's. The{Iona Community,}a worldwide ecumenical Christian organisation concerned with peace and justice has its H.Q. at the Pearce Institute in Govan. There are small numbers of other faiths including Mormons, Muslims and Hindus living in the area.
